title: SUBGRAPH: Prove that 39 and 42 are equivalent
author: teorth

comments.body: This isn't true---the naturals with `x ∘ y = y` satisfy 39 (`x ∘ x = y ∘ x`) but not 42 (`x ∘ y = x ∘ z`), and the naturals with `x ∘ y = x` satisfy 42 but not 39
Oh, good point, that was silly on my part.

satisfaction_conditions: Demonstrates that statements 39 and 42 are not logically equivalent by showing they can fail independently
Addresses both directions of implication (39→42 and 42→39)
